Services

Let's discuss how I can bring value to your business!

Analytics Engineering

With a background in full stack web development and data science, I'm capable of producing results that can help to solve your business problems through analytics, visualization, and or machine learning. The core tools of my work include Python, SQL, Spark, Jupyter, and Javascript. I'm a dedicated partner. I will work with you and your team to identify root causes and provide high quality solutions!

Technical Blog

I'll be writing about my work and the times in which an enormous amount of troubleshooting and debugging pays off! I want to share my findings here with you! It's these little triumphs everyday that make me smile and keep moving forward!

How to Use PySpark createOrReplaceTempView()'s!
We will review how you can query large datasets using this helpful function!

Visualizations to Determine Correlation!

Building a Histogram in Trino!
We'll take a look at Trino's (formerly Presto) histogram function to support data analysis in SQL.

The Great Bayesian Average!
We'll walk through how we can utilize this averaging technique to synthesize multiple metrics to one aggregate score!

About

A brief bio below and links to important resources here:
  • LinkedIn
  • Github

    • Beginning 2014 through 2017

      My Humble Beginnings

      My passion for computer science began in 2014, and I also started my MBA, then graduated with a 4.0 GPA in 2015.


      In 2016, I started a Web Development Certificate at UC Davis learning JavaScript, HTML/CSS, and MySQL building my first website!


      During this time I was also working for SAGE Publishing, and in 2017, I achieved $2M+ in sales and got accepted to their Leadership Council!

    • August 2017 to June 2018

      UCLA Bootcamp to Graduation!

      Then in July 2017, wanting to take my skills further, I decided to enroll in the UCLA Extension Full Stack Developer certificate program and was accepted.


      Starting in August 2017, I began my programming studies at UCLA Extension pursuing the Full Stack Developer certificate. That experience was incredible as I learned to create VR, MERN, MySQL, and JavaScript web applications while, obtaining a client for our Google beacon technology project.


      We were also lucky enough to pitch out Google beacon technology project to the Walt Disney Concert Hall! This was a pivotal time as it helped me to learn about business needs and technical solutions!


    • July 2018 to December 2020

      Networking to Startups and Big Changes!

      After UCLA Extension graduation, and a lot of networking, I was able to work for two startups, one was a YCombinator, building Vue components, managing AWS EC2 instances, S3, security, permissions, VPC, coding with an open banking API, Mongo and much more!


      Finally, from earlier networking, I met an incredible and talented Data Engineer, Evan, who told me about the internal opportunity at Netflix of which I applied for and got in, as a Data Specialist, for the Content Knowledge Graph team!


      Starting work at Netflix required me to uplevel my skills in SQL, and Python which was challenging and rewarding! Then starting in 2019, wanting to take my skills further, I completed necessary prerequisites at Santa Monica College to start a Computer Science Masters and a few Udacity Nanodegree's along the way!


    • January 2021 to August 2022

      Computer Science Master to Analytics Enginner

      In early 2021, I applied to Loyola Marymount University and was accepted to their Computer Science Masters program which I began in the Fall of 2021, all while continuing to work at Netflix.


      Currently, I am an Analytics Engineer at Netflix on the Content Knowledge Graph team in the Data Science & Engineering division! Here, I perform data engineering, data analyst and specialist based functions, working with Python, PySpark, SQL (Trino or Snowflake), building ETL pipelines, scheduling audits, and managaing a data labeling external workforce.


      I also perform analytical functions using machine learning, data wrangling, and investigative research, along with data vizualizations using Plotly, Tableau and many other visualization tools. In this position, I work with data scientists, stakeholders, and partners, along with our ML and data engineers on the CKG team, all of which is the most amazing part of this role! We solve big challenges to provide our Netflix teams valuable data with insights!

    • December 2022 to Present

      Engineering Work to Serve Others

      As of August 2022, I've received a certificate of Applied Data Science from MIT.


      Longer term, I am pursuing consultant work such as helping local businesses with their data science development to identify root causes of business problems to then build high quality and sustaining solutions!

    • Thank you
      for viewing
      my portfolio!

    Physical Web Museum

    Custom beacon URLs for events!

    We developed a simple web application to import assets such as images, audio and video files to create a custom beacon URL!

    Check our Github here and our Heroku website for the beacon application

    • Date: January 2018

    • Client: Google and the Los Angeles Philharmonic Walt Disney Concert Hall
    • Category: Beacon Technology Web Application
    • Purpose: This app provided a way for customers to have access to artwork information such as artist, date created, social media, etc., which appeared via notifications on their iOS or Android devices with Nearby enabled. Each art piece had a beacon located near it which emitted BLE and generated the URL noticication. The event hall and artist now had a way to directly engage their user!

    NASA Fireball API

    Get NASA Fireball API data in real time!

    Get real time NASA data for fireballs and when they cross our earths path! You can also see NASA Twitter feed all via JSON format!

    My Github is here and Heroku live site here

    • Date: February 2018

    • Category: NASA Data
    • Purpose: This app was created to have access to NASA fireball data and NASA tweets in JSON format for easy viewing.

    Motivational VR Web App

    React, MongoDB, and A-Frame!

    Built an social networking app with my teammate Alex, that brings you closer to people through VR! This is our first iteration but, next iteration will include more A-Frame features, more profiles, a search by category, and React Native capability!

    My Github is here and Heroku live site here

    • Date: February 2018

    • Category: VR and Social Media
    • Purpose: This app was created to showcase user lifestyle and hobbies to help others find out if they too would like to pursue these areas of interest. We used the idea of VR to show how each user experiences their hobbies and lifestyle.

    Mongo New York Times Scraper

    Cheerio, MongoDB, Node, and Handlebars

    Built an app that scrapes New York Times articles, giving you the option to save or delete them! Here I used Cheerio and the New York Times API key to get new articles, then utilized CRUD and ORM operations to GET, POST and DELETE the articles using Mongoose for our MongoDB database!

    My Github is here and Heroku live site here

    • Date: October 2017

    • Category: Web Scraper
    • Purpose: This app was created to easily scrape The New York Times for searchable topics and articles saved for later reading.

    My Github is here and Heroku live site here

    • Purpose: This app was created to show how React works with gaming logic.

    Fintech Dashboard

    MEVN, Chart.js, ElementUI, PM2, Linux and AWS!


    Startup app using MEVN, Chart.js, ElementUI, AWS (EC2/Linux) and an open banking API with Google Login flow! First time setting up EC2 instances, in a VPC with subnets using PM2. The repo is private so ping me for more details!

    • Date: July 2018

    • Category: Fintech
    • Purpose: This app was created to show user subscriptions through an analytics UI built on Vue which interacted with an open banking API securely running on a Mongo database schema and AWS servers. The user can then see if their subscription fees are increasing or decreasing on a daily basis.

    Events App

    React, Redux Thunk, Firestore, Firebase and Cloud Hosting!

    Events web app for your business and colleagues to setup times to meet and talk about your business projects! This app uses Google Maps, React/Redux Thunk, Firebase, Firestore and was deployed on the Cloud with Firebase hosting! To ensure a good experience please register first! There are many features including infinite scroll, chat, maps, adding, joining, and canceling events, plus Google authentication. This started from a tutorial and for me to better learn Google Firebase!

    During deployment I learned about code splitting, and npm analyze which showed me all of the dependencies and their percentage in usage. I learned about Firebase Cloud Functions and how to createActivity and cancelActivity which were "events" users were engaging with on the app that Firebase was "listening" for. This app is still in development and key features to add are security, Facebook login, and being able to follow your colleagues. Please let me know what you think!


    My Github is here and Firebase Hosting live site here

    • Date: December 2018

    • Category: Events and Social Media
    • Purpose: This app was created to allow business partners and teams to easily and securely log in to a platform in which they can schedule business meetings while keeping user profiles that feature photos and chat.

    NASA InSight API

    Python, Flask, Bootstrap, and Twilio!

    This API gets you the most recent Mars InSight Images faster than searching on NASA's site! Get SMS updates when new images have been received from the API!

    During deployment I learned about setting up a Flask environment with templates and static folders directories, along with understanding how Bootstrap can work with forms. Python works easily with other libraries such as WTForms, and Twilio. Setting up your environment variables can be done in a few ways and I chose to use the os module. Flask requires specific syntax in the HTML file such as 'url_for' and code blocks for specific HTML components like Header, Footer, and Script tags. My goal is to get the SMS and email up and running along with an SQLite database to store emails and phone numbers so I can send updates to users when new images are posted to the API. I have another few iterations planned out and am excited to get this out there to those who love learning about our planet Mars! Keep reaching for the planets!


    My Github is here and Heroku hosting live site here

    • Date: February 2019

    • Category: API
    • Purpose: This app was created to allow users to access most recent Mars InSight raw images in an easy and user-friendly way rather than searching NASA's home page. The notifications feature intent is to have users recieve updates in real time when new images are posted.

    Data Structure and Algorithms!

    Udacity Nanodegree DSA & Computer Science Fundamentals

    This includes projects from Udacity DSA Nanodegree, and my own DSA practice! Walk with me on this journey as I learn and engage with data structures and algorithms!


    My own practice Github repo is here and the two Udacity DSA Nanodegree projects are here and here

    • Date: June 2019

    • Category: Practice & Study for Work
    • Purpose: These projects were created during my enrollment in the Udacity DSA Nanodegree, the intent is to build my DSA knowledge and keep growing from there!

    Data Analysis Projects

    Jupyter Notebooks, Pandas, Python!

    The following are images from the four required projects of the Data Analyst Udacity Nanodegree program!

    This includes projects from Udacity DSA Nanodegree! This program introduced me to concepts like measures of spread, and center, univariate, bivariate and multivariate charts, the Central Limit Theorum, confidence intervals and p-values, testing for the null hypothesis and what statistical significance is, while also diving into regression, linear, multi and logistical, using Python's statsmodels to build OLS, and Logit statistical summaries!

    Along this journey I've become entirely proficient in Pandas, while still tackling the depths of Numpy including understanding vectorization, and matrices. Building visualizations is the most fascinating and fun and I have to say my favorite is visual tool is seaborn albeit some limitations, while of course matplotlib is next in line, additionally, a new platform like Plotly is also useful and of course at work I have access to Tableau which is very powerful as well especially for delivering dashboards that tell a story about your data to stakeholders, partners, and user of your data! I am quite in love with it all!


    My Udacity DA Nanodegree projects: the second one here the fifth one here and the third one here
    • Date: September 2019

    • Category: Practice & Study for Work
    • Purpose: These projects were created during my enrollment in the Udacity DA Nanodegree, the intent is to build my DA knowledge and keep growing from there!
